text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/80d868ec25094615f2531a1e01ed1e729366c3bc|patch 8.2.2019: swap file test fails on MS-Windows>
patch 8.2.2019: swap file test fails on MS-Windows

Problem:    Swap file test fails on MS-Windows.
Solution:   Add four to the process ID. (Ken Takata, closes #7333)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2019: swap file test fails on MS-Windows · vim/vim@80d868e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2019: swap file test fails on MS-Windows · vim/vim@80d868e
attachments.text: Problem: Swap file test fails on MS-Windows. Solution: Add four to the process ID. (Ken Takata, closes #7333)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/2ea95b61f4bec9b71cf916eebe8d11abc76617a0|patch 8.2.2018: Vim9: script variable not found from lambda>
patch 8.2.2018: Vim9: script variable not found from lambda

Problem:    Vim9: script variable not found from lambda.
Solution:   In a lambda also check the script hashtab for a variable without a
            scope. (closes #7329)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2018: Vim9: script variable not found from lambda · vim/vim@2ea95b6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2018: Vim9: script variable not found from lambda · vim/vim@2ea95b6
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: script variable not found from lambda. Solution: In a lambda also check the script hashtab for a variable without a scope. (closes #7329)

text:

patch 8.2.2017: missing part of the dict change

Problem:    Missing part of the dict change.
Solution:   Also change the script level dict.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c6ca9f3a29bfd6f5269749036f79f63ce6289692|patch 8.2.2016: swap file test is a little flaky>
patch 8.2.2016: swap file test is a little flaky

Problem:    Swap file test is a little flaky.
Solution:   Don't set a byte to a fixed value, increment it.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2016: swap file test is a little flaky · vim/vim@c6ca9f3
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2016: swap file test is a little flaky · vim/vim@c6ca9f3
attachments.text: Problem: Swap file test is a little flaky. Solution: Don't set a byte to a fixed value, increment it.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/2bede173a177e227e6224a8713f5b88a38d011af|patch 8.2.2015: Vim9: literal dict #{} is not like any other language>
patch 8.2.2015: Vim9: literal dict #{} is not like any other language

Problem:    Vim9: literal dict #{} is not like any other language.
Solution:   Support the JavaScript syntax.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2015: Vim9: literal dict #{} is not like any other language · vim/vim@2bede17
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2015: Vim9: literal dict #{} is not like any other language · vim/vim@2bede17
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: literal dict #{} is not like any other language. Solution: Support the JavaScript syntax.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ee8b787bcd15f63a938243770065e704c9b5c85f|patch 8.2.2014: using CTRL-O in a prompt buffer moves cursor to start>
patch 8.2.2014: using CTRL-O in a prompt buffer moves cursor to start

Problem:    Using CTRL-O in a prompt buffer moves cursor to start of the line.
Solution:   Do not move the cursor when restarting edit. (closes #7330)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2014: using CTRL-O in a prompt buffer moves cursor to start · vim/vim@ee8b787
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2014: using CTRL-O in a prompt buffer moves cursor to start · vim/vim@ee8b787
attachments.text: Problem: Using CTRL-O in a prompt buffer moves cursor to start of the line. Solution: Do not move the cursor when restarting edit. (closes #7330)
